jade.util
Class Dice

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Random
      jade.util.Dice
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Dice
extends java.util.Random
implements java.io.Serializable

Dice basically extends Random and adds a few methods. Eventually, I may reimplement Random as a Mersenne Twister.

See Also:

Method Detail

nextInt

public int nextInt(int min,
                   int max)
Returns a random integer between the min and max inclusive. In order for this method to work, min must be less than max.

Parameters:
min - the minimum result
max - the maximum result
Returns:
a random integer between the min and max inclusive.

diceXdY

public int diceXdY(int x,
                   int y)
Performs an xdy dice roll where x number of y sided dice are rolled. Thus the minimum value returned from this function is x (ie all the dice were 1s). The maximum value this function could take is x * y (ie all dice rolled their highest value). However, as x increases, the probability curve becomes more normally distributed.

Parameters:
x - the number of dice to roll
y - the number of sides the dice have
Returns:
the total value of all the dice rolled.

nextColor

public java.awt.Color nextColor()
Returns a psuedorandom color with r,g,b values from 0 to 255.

Returns:
a psuedorandom color with r,g,b values from 0 to 255.

nextChar

public char nextChar(char min,
                     char max)
Returns a random char between the min and max char on the ascii table (inclusive).

Parameters:
min - the minium ascii value that could be returned
max - the maximuc ascii value that could be returned
Returns:
a random char between the min and max char on the ascii table
